block.p: An opinionated guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 229 West 43d Street, New York, N.Y. 10036; by fax to (212) 556-7219, or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
MUSIC
BICKFORD THEATER Paris Washboard, jazz quartet. Tomorrow at 8 p.m. Tickets: $12. Morris Museum, 6 Normandy Heights Road, Morristown. (973) 538-0454.

An opinionated guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 229 West 43d Street, New York, N.Y. 10036; by fax to (212) 556-7219, or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
MUSIC
BICKFORD THEATER Paris Washboard, jazz quartet. Tomorrow at 8 p.m. Tickets: $12. Morris Museum, 6 Normandy Heights Road, Morristown. (973) 538-0454.

THE CORNERSTONE ''Fine Food . . . and all that Jazz.'' Kenny Davern Quartet with John Bunch. Wednesday, 7:30 p.m. to 11:30 p.m. Alan Fardham Quartet, with Randy Sandke. Friday, 9 p.m. to 1 a.m. Pete Yellin Quartet. Saturday, 9 p.m. to 1 a.m. 25 New Street, Metuchen. (732) 549-5306.

COUNT BASIE THEATER New Jersey Symphony Orchestra presents Haydn's ''Creation,'' featuring Margaret Cahn, soprano, and Zdenek Macal, conductor. Saturday at 8:30 p.m. Tickets: $12 to $42. 99 Monmouth Street, Red Bank. (732) 842-9000.
DREW UNIVERSITY Drew Cabaret concert to benefit the Center for Holocaust Study. Today at 3:30 p.m. Tickets: Starting at $85. Baldwin Gymnasium, Madison Avenue, Madison. (973) 408-3600.

JOHN HARMS CENTER FOR THE ARTS ''An Evening With Marvin Hamlisch.'' Today at 3 p.m. Tickets: $25 to $45. The New Jersey Symphony Orchestra presents Haydn's ''Creation,'' featuring Margaret Cahn, soprano, and Zdenek Macal, conductor. Thursday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $12 to $42. 30 North Van Brunt Street, Englewood. (201) 567-3600.

McCARTER THEATER Beaux Arts Trio performs works by Beethoven, Shostakovich and Brahms, featuring Menahem Pressler, pianist; Young Uck-Kim, violinist; Antonio Meneses, cellist. Tomorrow at 8 p.m. Tickets: $25 and $25. 91 University Place, Princeton. (609) 258-2787.

NEW JERSEY CITY UNIVERSITY The New Jersey City University Contemporary Chamber Ensemble presents a concert of Bozza, Hindemith, Roussel and Schoenberg works. Tomorrow at 8 p.m. Free. Ingalls Recital Hall, Rossey Building, 2039 Kennedy Boulevard, Jersey City. (201) 200-3151.

NEW JERSEY PERFORMING ARTS CENTER ''Cellomania.'' Today at 3 p.m. Victoria Theater. Tickets: $25; $15 for students. Prudential Hall. ''100 Years of Strauss Gala,'' featuring Andre Rieu and his Johann Strauss Orchestra. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $35 to $75. Prudential Hall. ''Jazz for Teens,'' concert of music of Dizzy Gillespie and other jazz greats. Saturday at 12:30 p.m. Tickets: $12; $7 for children. Victoria Theater. ''Jazz Generations,'' featuring Milt Jackson Quartet with the Baby Legends. Saturday at 7 p.m. Tickets: $18; $9 for children. Victoria Theater. 1 Center Street, Newark. (888) 466-5722.

PRINCETON UNIVERSITY RICHARDSON AUDITORIUM New Jersey Youth Symphony Orchestra with Raritan Valley Chorus and New Jersey Youth Symphony Choir in Nelhybel, Puccini, Mendelssohn and Enesco program. Today at 4 p.m. Tickets: $10; $5 for students and older people. ''Composing in the Moment: The Distinguished Teachers of Jazz at Princeton.'' Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $26, $23, $17; $10 for students. New Jersey Symphony Orchestra and the Pro Arte Chorale present Haydn's ''Creation.'' Next Sunday at 3 p.m. Tickets: $12 to $42. Alexander Hall, Princeton. (609) 258-5000.

PRINCETON UNIVERSITY TAPLIN AUDITORIUM ''Music 326,'' original student electronic and computer compositions. Tomorrow at 8 p.m. Free. Student recital of Schubert, Schumann, Copland and Berlin works. Wednesday at 8 p.m. Free. Princeton University Juniors and Seniors present a program of new compositions. Thursday at 8 p.m. Free. Georgios Demertzis, violinist; Maria Kitsopoulos, cellist and Maria Asteriadou, pianist, perform works by Nikos Skalkottas. Friday at 8 p.m. Taplin Auditorium, Fine Hall. Washington Road, Princeton. (609) 258-4239.

RAMAPO COLLEGE ''Salute to Louis Armstrong,'' with Byron Stipling, jazz trumpeter. Thursday at 7 p.m. Tickets: $15; $10 for older people; $5 for students. Berrie Center for the Performing Arts, 505 Ramapo Valley Road, Mahwah. (201) 684-7844.

RARITAN RIVER MUSIC FESTIVAL 2000 ''Ethos Percussion Group.'' Saturday at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $17; $10 for students and older people. Old Greenwich Presbyterian Church, Route 173, 2 1/2 miles west of Route 78's Exit 7, Bloomsbury. (908) 213-1100.
ROWAN UNIVERSITY David Sanborn, jazz. Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $22.50, $24.50, $27.50. Glassboro Center for the Arts, Route 322, Glassboro. (856) 256-4545.

RUTGERS UNIVERSITY - NEW BRUNSWICK New Jersey Youth Symphony performs Act I of Wagner's ''Die Walkure.'' Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $5 to $50. Nicholas Music Center, George Street, Douglass Campus, New Brunswick. (908) 771-5544.

RUTGERS UNIVERSITY Amabile String Quartet in a program of works by Mozart, Bartok and Beethoven. Today at 4 p.m. Free. Mason Gross School of the Arts, 33 Livingston Street, New Brunswick. (732) 932-7511.

STANHOPE HOUSE Riff, acoustic guitarist. Thursday at 9 p.m. Tickets: $5. Black Widow Blues Band. Friday at 10 p.m. Tickets: $7. Loup Garou, zydeco. Saturday at 10 p.m. Tickets: $10. 45 Main Street, Stanhope. (973) 347-0458.
STATE THEATER New Jersey Symphony Orchestra presents a Family Concert. Today at 2 p.m. Tickets: $16 and $11. 15 Livingston Avenue, New Brunswick. (732) 246-7469.

STOCKTON PERFORMING ARTS CENTER Bay Atlantic Symphony presents ''Third's the Charm,'' featuring Richard Raymond, pianist, and works by Brahms and Prokofiev. Today at 4 p.m. Tickets: $23 and $18. Jim Leeds Road, Pomona. (609) 652-4527.

TRENTON WAR MEMORIAL The Greater Trenton Symphony Orchestra presents ''Viva Italia,'' a program of Bellini, Rossini and Verdi featuring Fernando Raucci, conductor, and Roberto Larussi, tenor. Today at 3 and 7 p.m. Tickets: $15 to $30. Gala concert to benefit the Education Law Center, a statewide advocacy group, with the Spirit Ensemble, and local high school music groups. Thursday at 7:30 p.m Tickets: $20 to $100. Lafayette and Willow Streets, Trenton. (973) 624-3713, ext. 255 or (609) 984-8400.
UNION COUNTY ARTS CENTER Patti LuPone in ''Matters of the Heart.'' Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $40 to $60. 1601 Irving Street, Rahway. (732) 499-8226.
WATCHUNG ARTS CENTER Bob Seeley, jazz pianist. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $12. Watchung Circle, 18 Stirling Road, Watchung. (908) 753-0190.
WEST SIDE PRESBYTERIAN CHURCH ENGLEWOOD Bergen Chorale in a concert of Copland and Bach. Saturday at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $12; $10 for students. Knickerborck Road and Demarest Avenue. (201) 569-3787.

WEST SIDE PRESBYTERIAN CHURCH RIDGEWOOD Chorus Angelicus Children's Chorus performs a benefit concert featuring Britten's ''Missa Brevis'' and other works. Today at 4 p.m. Tickets: $60 to $300. South Monroe Street and West Ridgewood Avenue. (201) 652-1966.
Theater

AMERICAN STAGE COMPANY ''Ain't Misbehavin','' musical. Through May 21. Wednesdays at 2:30 p.m.; Thursdays at 7:30 p.m.; Fridays and Saturdays at 8 p.m.; and Sundays at 2:30 p.m. and 7 p.m. Tickets: $20 to $30. Becton Hall, Fairleigh Dickinson University, 1000 River Road, Teaneck. (201) 692-7744.
ATTIC ENSEMBLE ''All My Sons,'' Arthur Miller's classic drama. Today at 3 p.m. Tickets: $15; $10 for students and older people. Barrow Mansion, 83 Wayne Street, Jersey City. (201) 413-9200.

BERGEN COUNTY PLAYERS Walter Jones's ''1940's Radio Hour,'' musical comedy. Through May 20. Fridays and Saturdays at 8:30 p.m.; Sundays at 2 p.m. Tickets: $15. The Little Firehouse Theater, 298 Kinderkamack Road, Oradell. (201) 261-4200.

CIRCLE PLAYERS ''A View From the Bridge,'' drama by Arthur Miller. Through May 20. Friday and Saturday evening performances at 8:30 p.m.; one Sunday matinee today at 2 p.m. Tickets: $12; $11 for students and older people. 416 Victoria Avenue, Piscataway. (732) 968-7555.

COMMUNITY THEATER OF MORRISTOWN Shakespeare Live! A Midsummer's Night Dream. Today at 2 p.m. Tickets: $22, $28 and $33. New Jersey Ballet presents ''An Evening of Premieres,'' featuring ''Western Suite,'' ''Memories'' and ''Reflection on the Pond.'' Tickets: $25, $20, $15; $10 for students. 100 South Street, Morristown. (973) 539-8008.

CROSSROADS THEATER COMPANY ''Genesis Festival 2000, New Voices in African-American Theater,'' starring Avery Brooks and Joe Morton. ''Mandela, a New Musical.'' Today at 3 p.m. and 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $15. Livingston Avenue, New Brunswick. (732) 246-5560.
FORUM THEATER COMPANY ''Nunsense,'' by Dan Goggin. Through next Sunday. Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m.; next Sunday at 2 p.m. Tickets: $30 and $32. 314 Main Street, Metuchen. (732) 548-0582.

GEORGE STREET PLAYHOUSE ''Ancestral Voices,'' by A. R. Gurney. Through May 28. Tuesdays through Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Saturdays at 2 p.m.; Sundays and 2 p.m. and 7 p.m. Tickets: $22 to $40. The Next Stage Festival. Friday through June 11. Reno and Christina Anderson. Friday at 8 p.m. Carmeltia Tropicana and Trazana Beverley. Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $10. 9 Livingston Avenue, New Brunswick. (732) 246-7717.

HUNTERDON HILLS PLAYHOUSE ''Mary, Mary,'' Jean Kerr's comedy. Through June 30. Monday through Saturday luncheon performances at 11 a.m., $35.50 and $39.50; Saturdays at 6:30 p.m., $43 and $47; Sundays at 3:30 p.m., $41.50 and $45.50. Reservations required. Exit 12 off Routes 78 and 22, Perryville. (800) 447-7313.
KEAN COLLEGE New Jersey Ballet presents ''Carnival of the Animals.'' Today at 2 p.m. Tickets: $7. Wilkins Theater, 1000 Morris Avenue, Union. (908) 527-2337.
KELSEY THEATER ''A Chorus Line.'' Today at 3 p.m. Tickets: $9 to $18. Mercer County Community College, 1200 Trenton Road, Trenton. (609) 584-9444.

LUNA STAGE ''Jaques Brel Is Alive and Well and Living in Paris,'' 1960's revue. Through May 21. Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sundays at 2 p.m. Tickets: $12, Thursdays; $22, Friday through Sunday; $18 for students and older people; $27, opening night. 7 Oak Place, Montclair. (973) 744-3309.
McCARTER THEATER ''Night Governess,'' world premiere musical by Polly Penn. Through May 21. Tickets: $20 to $39. Center for the Performing Arts, 91 University Place, Princeton. (609) 258-2787.

MAGNET THEATER COMPANY ''The Foreigner'' by Larry Shue. Through next Sunday. Thursday, Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m.; today and next Sunday at 2 p.m. Tickets: $12 for Thursday evening and Sunday matinees; $15 for Friday and Saturday; $10 for students and older people. Mill Hill Playhouse, Montgomery and Front Streets, Trenton. (609) 392-5589.

MONTCLAIR STATE UNIVERSITY ''Shim Chung -- The Blindman's Daughter,'' performed by the Universal Ballet of Korea. Today at 7 p.m. Tickets: $25; $15 for students and older people. Memorial Auditorium, Valley Road and Normal Avenue, Upper Montclair. (973) 655-5112.
MONMOUTH UNIVERSITY David Dorfman Dance. Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $22. Pollak Auditorium, Cedar Avenue, West Long Branch. (732) 571-3483.

NEW JERSEY PERFORMING ARTS CENTER Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater. Friday through next Sunday. Friday at 8 p.m.; Saturday at 2 p.m. and 8 p.m.; next Sunday at 3 p.m. Tickets: $15 to $64. Prudential Hall. 1 Center Street, Newark. (888) 466-5722.
RADBURN PLAYERS Tennessee Williams's ''Cat on a Hot Tin Roof.'' Today at 2 p.m. Tickets: $10; $8 for students and older people. The Grange, 29-20 Fair Lawn Avenue, Fair Lawn. (973) 595-5629.
RAMAPO COLLEGE American Repertory Ballet presents ''Romeo and Juliet.'' Today at 2 p.m. Tickets: $25; $12.50 for students. Sharp Theater, 505 Ramapo Valley Road, Mahwah. (201) 684-7844.

SOUTH STREET PLAYERS ''Twelve Angry Men,'' dinner theater production. Friday and Saturday. Dinner begins at 7:30 p.m. Cost: $30 for dinner and show. Clarksburg Inn, Routes 524 and 571, Clarksburg. (732) 462-4329.
STATE THEATER American Repertory Ballet presents ''Romeo and Juliet.'' Saturday at 2 p.m. and 8 p.m. Tickets: $14 to $32. 15 Livingston Avenue, New Brunswick. (732) 246-7469.
Museums and Galleries

AMERICAN LABOR MUSEUM ''Vital Vestiges,'' a photodocumentary of the Paterson historic district's ruins. ''What is Industrial Hygiene?'' photo and illustration exhibit on loan from the American Industrial Hygiene Association in Virginia. Through June 25. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 1 to 4 p.m.; other times by appointment. Botto House National Landmark, 83 Norwood Street, Haledon. (973) 595-7953.

CLEOPATRA STEPS OUT GALLERY ''Roadside New Jersey: A Celebration of the State's Glorious Eccentricities,'' Peter Genovese, author, chronicles New Jersey's roadside attractions in photographs and objects. Through May 20. Hours: Thursdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Mondays through Wednesdays by appointment. 721 Cookman Avenue, Asbury Park. (732) 774-6306.
CLIFTON ARTS CENTER ''Sculpture: Inside and Out.'' Through May 21. Hours: Thursday through Saturday, noon to 4 p.m.; Sunday, 1 to 4 p.m. Clifton and Van Houten Avenues, Clifton. (973) 472-5499.

COOPER GALLERY ''Dancing Shapes in Rhythmic Space,'' paintings and sculpture by Jenne Currie. Through May 26. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, noon to 7 p.m. 295 Grove Street, Jersey City. (201) 451-1074.

FAIRLEIGH DICKINSON UNIVERSITY ''Inner and Outer Reality,'' mixed media exhibit, by Ruth Rintel. Tomorrow through June 2. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 2 p.m. Edward Williams Gallery, 150 Kotte Place, Hackensack. (201) 692-2449.

FIREHOUSE GALLERY ''Diversity: A Celebration of Individual Expression.'' Through May 31. Hours: Fridays and Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Wednesdays, 4 p.m. to 9 p.m.; Sundays, 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. 8 Walnut Street, Bordentown. (609) 298-3742.

GROUNDS FOR SCULPTURE ''Spring Exhibition'' featuring Red Grooms: sculpture; Bill Barrett: sculpture and painting; and Andrzej Pitynski: partisans. Through July 2. Hours: Thursdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Tuesday and Wednesday by appointment. 18 Fairgrounds Road, Hamilton Township. (609) 586-0616.
JOHN HARMS CENTER FOR THE ARTS ''Arborealis,'' photography by Cali Gorevic. Through May 24. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. 30 North Van Brunt Street, Englewood. (201) 567-3600.

HUNTERDON MUSEUM OF ART ''Robert Forman: 'Narratives in Thread' and 'Huichol Art in the Collection of Robert Forman.' '' Through June 18. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. 7 Lower Center Street, Clinton. (908) 735-8415.

J.C.C. ON THE PALISADES ''Mysticism and Mosaics,'' an exhibit of lithographs, seriagraphs, prints and original mosaics by Michoel Muchnik, artist. Through May 30. Reception: today, 1 p.m. to 3 p.m. Hours: Monday through Thursday, 9 a.m to 10 p.m.; Friday and Sunday, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. 411 East Clinton Avenue, Tenafly. (201) 569-7900, extension 433.

KERYGMA GALLERY ''Flowers: In the Still Life and Landscape,'' group show of gallery artists. Through May 27. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. 38 Oak Street, Ridgewood. (201) 444-5510.

LIBERTY HALL MUSEUM Grand Opening -- a historic house museum offering a unique view of New Jersey's history. Opening weekend celebration: today, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. 1003 Morris Avenue (across from Kean University), Union. (908) 527-0400.

LIBERTY SCIENCE CENTER ''Lakota Wolf Preserve,'' photographs by Dan Bacon. Through June 18. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 9:30 to 5:30 p.m. Environment Level, Liberty State Park, 251 Phillip Street, Jersey City. (201) 451-0006, extension 295.

MARSHA CHILD CONTEMPORARY ''Worlds on Paper,'' an exhibition of paintings, drawings, etchings, mezzotints, and more by artists from a dozen countries. Through May 27. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5:30 p.m.; other times by appointment. 220 Alexander Street, Princeton. (609) 497-7330.

MONTCLAIR ART MUSEUM ''Untamed Spirits: Animal Imagery in Native American Art.'' Through July 30. Hours: Tuesdays, Wednesdays, Fridays and Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Thursdays and Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Admission: $5; $4 for older people and students; free for members and children under 12. 3 South Mountain Avenue, Montclair. (973) 746-5555.

MORRIS MUSEUM ''Fresh Perspectives.'' Through June 5.''The Collected Century, 1900 to 2000.'' Through June 11. ''Ice Age,'' featuring casts of mammals from the Pleistocene epoch. Through June 18. Hours: Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m.; Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Thursdays to 8 p.m. Admission: $5; $3 for older people and children under age 3. 6 Normandy Heights Road, Morristown. (973) 538-0454.

NEW JERSEY CENTER FOR VISUAL ARTS ''On the Horizon: Landscape at the Millennium.'' Through June 11. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, noon to 4 p.m.; Thursdays, 7 to 9 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 2 to 4 p.m. Palmer Gallery, 68 Elm Street, Summit. (908) 273-9121.

NEW JERSEY HISTORICAL SOCIETY ''History's Mysteries,'' interactive exhibition. Through June. ''Dining In, Dining Out,'' featuring photographs, video clips, rare silverware, period furniture and 18th-century cookbooks. Through summer, 2001. ''Pride of Newark: Baseball's Bears and Eagles,'' about the history of baseball in Newark. Through Summer 2001. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. 52 Park Place, Newark. (973) 596-8500.

NEW JERSEY STATE MUSEUM Highlights from the Furniture and Painting Collections. Through next Sunday. ''Forgotten Gateway: The Abandoned Building of Ellis Island,'' photographs by Larry Racioppo. Through June 30. ''The Modernists.'' Ends today. ''The Regionalists and Precisionists.'' Ends today. ''Nikon's Small World, 1999-2000.'' Through May 23. Call for tickets: (800) 766-6048. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 4:45 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Free. 205 West State Street, Trenton. (609) 292-6464.

NEWARK MUSEUM ''From Tabletop to TV Tray: China and Glass in America, 1880-1980.'' Through June 18. ''Needless Necessity: Jewelry, Silver and Personal Meaning.'' Through December. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, noon to 5 p.m.; Thursdays (after hours) until 8:30 p.m. 49 Washington Street, Newark. (973) 596-6550.
WILLIAM PATERSON UNIVERSITY Three Generations of Hobart Family Photographers. Through June 4. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Hobart Manor, 300 Pompton Road, Wayne. (973) 720-2825.

PRINCETON UNIVERSITY ART MUSEUM ''Curator's Choice: Recent Acquisitions.'' Through June 6. Photographs by Barbara Bosworth. Through June 18. ''A Window Into Collecting American Folk Art: The Edward Duff Balken Collection.'' Through June 18. ''Flora and Fauna in Chinese Painting.'' Through July 30. Yayoi Kusama: Early Drawings From the Collection of Richard Castellane. Through July 30. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Princeton campus. (609) 258-3788.

RUTGERS UNIVERSITY MABEL SMITH DOUGLASS LIBRARY ''Paintings, Collages and Assemblages,'' by Siri Berg; on display in the sixth and final exhibition of the 1999-2000 Mary H. Dana Women Artists Series. Through May 22. Mondays through Thursdays, 8 a.m. to 1 a.m.; Fridays, 8 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 8 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 1 a.m. George Street and Nichol Avenue, New Brunswick. (732) 932-9407.

WHEATON VILLAGE ''American Glass: 1900-2000,'' featuring more than 100 industrial and decorative pieces. Through Oct. 22. ''2000 Flowers.'' Saturday through June 11. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Admission: $7; $6 for older people; $3.50 for students. Exit 26, Route 55, Millville. (800) 998-4552, extension 2756.

WILLIAMS GALLERY ''Etchings From Angkor, Cambodia, and Nara, Japan: Recent Works by Jorg Schmeisser.'' Through Saturday. Hours: Tuesday through Saturday, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; other times by appointment. 8 Chambers Street, Princeton. (609) 921-1142.
For Children

BERGEN COUNTY Y JEWISH COMMUNITY CENTER ''Magic Night!'' includes a performance by a professional magician, dinner and dessert. For children in kindergarten and first grade. Tickets: $18; $12 for members. 605 Pascack Road, Washington Township. (201) 666-6610, extension 210.

FORUM THEATER COMPANY ''Narnia; the Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe,'' based on the ''Chronicles of Narnia'' by C. S. Lewis. Through June 10. Saturdays at 11 a.m. Tickets: $9. 314 Main Street, Metuchen. (732) 548-0582.

HUNTERDON MUSEUM OF ART ''Spring Fever,'' workshops and classes for children and adults, including KinderArt, Cartooning Around, Collage Kids and more. Through June 8. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. 7 Lower Center Street, Clinton. (908) 735-8415.
KELSEY THEATER ''Little Red Riding Hood.'' Friday at 7 p.m.; Saturday and next Sunday at 2 p.m. and 4 p.m. Tickets: $7. Mercer County Community College, 1200 Trenton Road, Trenton. (609) 584-9444.

NEWARK MUSEUM ''Where in the Universe Is Carmen Sandiego?'' at the Alice and Leonard Dreyfuss Planetarium. Through October. Saturdays and Sundays, 1 p.m. and 3 p.m. Tickets: $3; $2 for members; $1 for children and older people. 49 Washington Street, Newark. (973) 596-6355.

NEW JERSEY STATE MUSEUM ''Laser Millennium 3-D,'' planetarium laser light show. Saturdays and Sundays at 1 and 3 p.m. Through June 25. Tickets: $6 includes 3-D glasses. 205 West State Street, Trenton. (609) 292-6464.

PAPER MILL PLAYHOUSE ''Hansel and Gretel'' and ''Goldilocks and the Three Bears.'' Today at 10 a.m. ''Snow White,'' performed by the Gingerbread Players and Jack. Saturday and next Sunday at 10 a.m. Tickets: $8 and $9. Brookside Drive, Millburn. (973) 376-4343.

RITZ THEATER ''The Fantasticks,'' musical. Through May 27. Fridays and Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sundays at 2 p.m.; Wednesdays, May 10 and May 24, 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $12.50 to $16. 915 White Horse Pike, Oaklyn. (856) 858-5230.

STOCKTON PERFORMING ARTS CENTER Green Thumb Theater for Young People presents ''The Beauty Machine.'' Tuesday at 10:30 a.m. and noon. Tickets: $6. Richard Stockton College, Jim Leeds Road, (609) 652-9000.

STUDIO PLAYERS Magic Trunk Children's Theater presents ''Who's Afraid of the Big Bad Wolf.'' Saturday and next Sunday at 1:30 and 3:30 p.m. Through May 21. Tickets: $6. 14 Alvin Place, Montclair. (973) 744-9752.

TRAILSIDE NATURE AND SCIENCE CENTER ''Pet Fair,'' featuring demonstrations by the Morris County 4-H Sled Dog Club and the Union County K-9 Division, vendors, contests and games. Today at 2 p.m. Admission: $1; free for children age 7 and younger. 452 New Providence Road, Mountainside. (908) 789-3670.

WATCHUNG PUBLIC LIBRARY Puppet Designers of Moorestown presents ''Four Little Piglets and Enviro the Wolf.'' For children ages 4 and older. Free, registration required. Thursday at 4 p.m. 12 Stirling Road, Watchung. (908) 561-0117.
Spoken Word
BARNES & NOBLE George B. Jacobs, M.D., author of ''A Simple Twist of Fate.'' Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. Free. 160 Route 17 North, Paramus. (201) 261-6995.

BOOKENDS BOOKSTORE Edward Rutherford, author of ''Sarum,'' ''Russka'' and ''London.'' Today at 1 p.m. Hamilton Jordan, chief of staff for President Carter and author of ''No Such Thing as a Bad Day.'' Wednesday at 7 p.m. Ilene Beckerman, author of ''Mother of the Bride: The Dream, the Reality, the Search for the Perfect Dress.'' Saturday at 1 p.m. Free. 232 East Ridgewood Avenue, Ridgewood. (201) 445-0726.

J.C.C. ON THE PALISADES Stephen J. Dubner, author of ''Turbulent Souls: A Catholic Son's Return to His Jewish Family.'' Thursday at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $18; $15 members and older people. 411 East Clinton Avenue, Tenafly. (201) 569-7900, extension 433.

JEWISH HISTORICAL SOCIETY OF METROWEST ''1925-1950: Entering the Mainstream,'' a lecture on Jewish life in America by Jenna W. Joselit, Ph.D., historian and author. Tuesday at 7:30 p.m. Free. Alex Aidekman Campus, Bleiweiss Center, 910 Route 10, Whippany. (973) 564-6466.

RAMAPO COLLEGE ''The Use of Jazz as Propaganda During the Third Reich,'' a multi-media lecture by Harold Lieberman, music professor and trumpeter. Tuesday at 7 p.m. Free. Berrie Center for the Performing Arts, 505 Ramapo Valley Road, Mahwah. (201) 684-7409.
Etc.
CRANFORD'S ANNUAL ARTS AND CRAFTS FESTIVAL Crafts, food and musical entertainment. Today, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Free admission and parking. Raindate May 28. Eastman Plaza, Cranford. (908) 996-3036.
JOHN HARMS CENTER FOR THE ARTS ''Excentrics,'' a theatrical circus show by Cirque Eloize. Saturday at 7 p.m. Tickets: $28 and $20. 30 North Van Brunt Street, Englewood. (201) 567-3600.

HOBOKEN SPRING ARTS AND MUSIC FESTIVAL Arts and crafts for display and sale, two music stages, children's activities and food vendors. Today, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Washington Street, from Newark to Seventh Streets. Free. (201) 420-2207.

HOME IMPROVEMENT FAIR Exhibitors include contractors, craftworkers and specialty dealers offering services and goods for remodelling or decorating. Today, 10:30 a.m to 7 p.m. Tickets: $40. Community and Recreational Center, Ninth Street and Marin Boulevard, Jersey City. (201) 798-9066.

MORRISTOWN NATIONAL HISTORIC PARK Two-hour, one-mile wildflower walk. Today at 2 p.m. Entrance fee: $4; free for children under age 16. Jockey Hollow Visitor Center, near exit 30B of Interstate 287. (908) 766-6841.

SOMERSET COUNTY PARK COMMISSION ''Woodland Walks at Leonard J. Buck Garden,'' guided tour. Sundays at 2 p.m. Through May 21. Admission: $3; $2 for students and older people. Visitor Center, 11 Layton Road, Far Hills. (908) 234-2677.
TRAILSIDE NATURE AND SCIENCE CENTER ''Astronomical Animals,'' planetarium show. Today, 2 and 3:30 p.m. Admission: $3; $2.55 for older people. 452 New Providence Road, Mountainside. (908) 789-3670.
At the Casinos
